content: sunflowers in support of ukraine designed by kirsti mcelligott inspiration i designed this hat when russia invaded ukraine in 2022 i had heard of the ukrainian woman telling the russian soldier take these seeds and put them in your pockets so at least sunflowers the ukrainian national flower will grow when you all lie down here the ukrainian flag which i learned is meant to represent a field of wheat under a blue sky reminded me of a field of sunflowers with a rich blue sky overhead i designed the sunflowers in a stranded knitting pattern to stand out on that horizon line illustrating the strength resilience and enduring future of ukraine it is on that note that i offer this pattern for free but ask that you consider donating to one of the charities that are helping the ukrainian people pattern notes the hat is knit in the round using sock weight yarn the stranded fair isle technique is used for the color work the yarn used in the photo is knitted wit 80% super wash merino 20% nylon 4oz 420 yards in yellow and ja jae copyright april 2025 kirsti mcelligott 1 materials abbreviations sock weight yarn 30g each of yellow c1 and bobble bind off blue c2 bor beginning of round c1 color 1 16 inch circular needle in size 2 50mm us 1 5 c2 color 2 double pointed needles in size 2 50mm us 1 5 co cast on or size to obtain gauge k knit kfb-m knit into front of stitch leaving stitch on darning needle and stitch markers needle put right needle into back of stitch and slip both stitches onto right needle gauge k2tog knit 2 stitches together pm place marker knit in stockinette stitch and using 2 50 mm us 1 5 needles gauge is 26 st and 40 row = 4 sm slip marker inches 10cm after blocking ssk slip slip knit size after blocking brim of hat measures 19 inches 48 25cm height of hat is 7½ inches 19cm fits head size 19 -
